department.label: Department information
department.mainInfo: The Department of Machining and Assembly (DMA) deals with machining metallic and non-metallic materials' theoretical and practical aspects. It also focuses on optimizing the cutting process in terms of a cutting tool, machined material, and cutting conditions during turning, milling, drilling, and grinding. The research focuses on machining tools and processes, which it analyzes in terms of machinability, optimization, and process fluids.
profFocusLabel: DMA Machining of metallic and non-metallic materials
divides into the following basic directions:

profFocus.label: Machining of classic metal materials
information: Evaluation of technological characteristics and reliability of cutting tools
Cutting conditions and their optimization in terms of a cutting tool and machined material
Chip formation when machining an instrument with a defined cutting edge geometry
Surface quality and dimensional stability after machining

profFocus.label: Machining of non-metallic and composite materials
information: Cutting conditions together with optimization of the machining process of non-metallic and composite materials
Process fluids for machining non-metallic and composite materials
Optimization of tools with defined and undefined cutting edge geometry
Surface quality and dimensional stability after machining of non-metallic and composite materials

profFocus.label: Related processes
information: Analysis and design of production processes, their optimization, and modernization
Assembly procedures, their analysis, strategy, and optimization
Engineering metrology - dimensional characteristics, quality, and surface quality

department.programLabel: For students, DMA provides teaching of professional subjects in the full-time and part-time form of study. It also offers topics for final theses in the bachelor's, masters, and doctoral study programs:

content.name: Mechanical Engineering - Mechanical Engineering Technology and Materials

labs.name: Laboratory of chip technologies and processes
labs.description: The laboratory of chip technologies and processes creates a technical background for solving research and development tasks in machining metals, plastics, and composite materials. It deals with machining theoretical and practical aspects with a focus on cutting tools, technical analysis, and the use of process fluids. One of the main goals is the offer of services associated with optimizing the cutting process in terms of tools, machined material, and cutting conditions. The laboratory is mainly focused on the technology of turning, milling, drilling, and grinding.
specialization: specification and evaluation of technical characteristics and reliability of cutting tools
definition of cutting conditions and their optimization in terms of a cutting tool and machined material
technological aspects assessment of process fluids
chip formation analysis when machining an instrument with a defined cutting edge geometry
evaluation of the surface quality and dimensional stability of the machine part after machining

equipment.label: Machinery equipment
value: lathes - CNC lathes DMG MORI CLX 350 a CHEVALIER FLC 400, SU 50/1500. Workpiece size až Ø 320 - 530 mm
milling machines - CNC milling machines DMG MORI CMX 600, FNG 32. Workpiece size až 600 x 560 x 510 mm
drill VS40 sprint
grinding machines - center grinding machine USR 500 N, BPH 320A, BPH 20, EBN 2-C, BN 102
saw  - PILOUS AGR 300+H.F.

equipment.label: Equipment and measuring systems
value: piezoelectric dynamometer KISTLER 9265 B
strain gauge two-component dynamometer for drilling
Accu-Lube micro lubrication system
SBS dynamic balancing system
system for monitoring the surface grinding process
three-phase power analyzer  DW – 6092
method for measuring the temperature during machining

technologies.label: Cutting tools
value: design and optimization of cutting tool geometry
evaluation of durability and reliability of cutting tools
evaluation of materials for tools and analysis of their applications

technologies.label: Machined materials (Metals, plastics, composites)
value: machinability tests
analysis and evaluation of difficult-to-machine materials
assessment of the volume coefficient of chips
evaluation of workpiece surface integrity

technologies.label: Cutting conditions
value: definition, design, evaluation, and optimization of cutting conditions during machining
analysis and assessment of the influence of the cutting environment
evaluation of process fluids - anti-adhesion ability, adhesion, etc.

technologies.label: Monitoring of technological parameters
value: evaluation of technical parameters - cutting force, temperature, deformation, vibration, etc.
research and development in the field of intelligent machining

labs.name: Laboratory of Engineering Metrology
labs.description: The Laboratory of Engineering Metrology has modern equipment for measuring the geometric properties of machine parts. The laboratory aims to create a range of comprehensive services, especially in measuring lengths and angles (1D, 2D, 3D). It is also equipped for accurate measurement of surface roughness parameters by touch method according to ČSN EN ISO 4287 and other standards. For non-contact measurement of surface roughness parameters, the laboratory is equipped with a confocal microscope and a 3D laser non-contact profilometer. Part of the offer is the analysis of the surface layer's properties by a digital Barkhausen noise analyzer. The laboratory is equipped with a thermomechanical analyzer for measuring the physical quantities of solids.
specialization: evaluation of surface roughness parameters and material fraction curves
non-destructive and rapid quality control and surface quality
non-destructive and immediate inspection of subsurface defects in ferromagnetic machine parts
measuring length dimensions by contact and non-contact method
measurement of plane and spatial angles by tactile and non-tactile methods

equipment.label: All equipment
value: Mitutoyo Surftest SV-2000N2 profilometer
KEYENCE VK-X1100 confocal microscope and 3D laser non-contact profiler
Barkhausen Noise Digital Analyzer MicroScan 600-1
Zeiss Prismo 5 coordinate measuring machine
thermomechanical analyzer TMA PT-1000LT
system for measuring the temperature during machining
Zeiss universal microscope
profile projector

technologies.label: Measurement of lengths and angles
value: tactile measurement of length and angular dimensions of components up to a maximum size of 800 × 1200 × 500 mm
non-contact measurement of length and angular dimensions of parts up to a maximum height of 100 × 200 × 300 mm

technologies.label: Surface topography of machine parts (Contact and non-contact surface quality measurement)
value: evaluation of parameters and surface roughness curves
analysis of the depth of the scratches event. other surface defects
accurate analyzes of complicated shaped surfaces
3D measurement of surface roughness parameters (grooves, threads, gears, etc.) for metallic, non-metallic, and elastic components
analysis of the thickness of applied coatings

technologies.label: Analysis of the properties of the surface layer of machine parts
value: detection of faults and cracks
evaluation of the influence of material, machining technology, and cutting conditions on the properties of the surface layer
evaluation of anomalies caused by changes in residual stress, hardness, and microstructure

labels.mainFocus: Main goals and activities of the laboratory:
labels.profFocus: The professional focus of the laboratory:

cooperation.cooperationInformation: The DMA complements' broad professional focus by the offer of professional advice, training, and contract research. Furthermore, cooperation on R&D projects, offering a free capacity of laboratories and additional industrial activities. The above activities support the connection of DMA with industrial practice.
cooperation.cooperationOffer: DMA offers partnerships in research. We will be delighted to help with research in a wide range of areas, from conventional machining of various materials through metrology to the design or optimization of production processes. The overlap of DMA's professional focus includes engineering construction, engineering technology, and prototype production.

wayPoints.name: The first contact
wayPoints.description: we will be pleased to acquaint ourselves with your request during the first contact, whether it is a solution to current operational or technological problems or a suggestion for cooperation in solving your plans or projects.

wayPoints.name: Design and selection of a team
wayPoints.description: during a working meeting (at our workplace or directly at your place), we will get acquainted in detail with your needs and develop a proposal for a solution and arrange cooperation with a specific professional team.

wayPoints.name: Implementation
wayPoints.description: we will actively participate in the solution of a common goal, which is a specific output in solving a problematic area, license, or long-term cooperation.
